It made for a little bit of noise in the evening as the kids were going up and down the halls, but overall the hotel was fairly peaceful. We had two rooms, one with double beds and one with a king bed. The king be room was missing a lamp and an alarm clock when we checked in, but once we told the front desk, the issue was fixed. We did not eat at the hotel, but the restaurant looked nice. We would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect Hilton quality”
Reviews.Author: shortcakes12
Reviews.Content: Although the room was nice and clean, the hotel appears to need renovation. The bathtub was old and stained. The water pressure was very poor. In the room with the ice machine/ vending machine, the floor was disgusting. There is an attached parking garage but spaces are limited and tiny. Location is great and staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mrxonia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. It is close to the rail system that will take you to any points in and around San Diego. Catch a ball game, visit the ocean front, stop and pursue the Mission. Hotel staff are exceptionally helpful in getting you where you want to be. If you are in San Diego only for business, take a breath:)

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough for the Price”
Reviews.Author: UtterDisbelief
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable, but nothing fancy. After reading other reviews, we requested and received an upper floor room facing the hillside so was able to avoid noise from the freeway. However, walls are not well insulated and we were able to hear everything going on in the next room and hallway. We had also read about rooms being burglarized so were a little paranoid about that too. The security bolt on the inside of our door did not fit properly, so this made us wonder if our room had been one of the victims. Also, there is no safe so we made sure never to leave anything of value in the room. Because we were able to get the room through Priceline at a discounted price of $65, we didn't feel quite as bad paying an additional $14 per day for self parking. They also charge an optional $10/day for internet. in your room, but it is available for free in the business center by the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful and the location was extremely convenient for everything we needed to do this trip. If we were able to book this hotel again at a discounted price, we would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “SURF”
Reviews.Author: TerriI
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay,went down to lower trestles to do some boogie boarding and surfing in San Clemente.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler56
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hilton Mission Valley for four nights, and the overall experience was positive. We requested a hill-facing room and they could accomodate our request. The location is not bad, if you have a car. The breakfast is not impressive, but acceptable. The door of our room (1026) showed signes of forcible entry, and you had to slam it to close. The room was fine, but it lacked a safe.

Reviews.Title: “About average for the Hilton Chain”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: Various pros and cons but overall this location is about average. The rooms are pretty small and the rates are pretty high. This is typical of San Diego though. Save some money and hit the Denny's next door for breakfast. This hotel is away from downtown and the water but the freeway makes for a short commute if there is no traffic. We saved about $100/night over the gaslamp and seaworld locations. We spent that on a rental car, which was a good trade. Overall this is a nice hotel. Just small and expensive. It works well if you plan on spending your days exploring the city though. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and good service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: abigezunt525
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our young son. The hotel was nice. Rooms were clean. Location is fantastic, with target and coffee bean right across the street (by car, theres a highway inbetween), amongst other shopping. Parking is 14 dollars but I was able to find parking overnight on the street (during business hours parking on the street is a bit more scarce). Booked on priceline for cheap rate. all in all good hotel. short drive to sea world downtown and many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but older hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdgirl01
Reviews.Content: Far away from the city, cost $20 for a taxi ride from the airport to our hotel or from our hotel to downtown. This Hilton wasnâ€™t spectacular. Looked old and a little run down. Iâ€™m glad a got a good deal on priceline.com â€“ $75+tax each night. Otherwise Iâ€™m sure it wouldâ€™ve been 200 a night just for the name. We didnâ€™t hav ea car so we just walked across the street (1/4 mile) to the Target and Corner Bakery CafÃ©. The trolley is also a short walk across the street, $5 all day, that pretty much takes you anywhere around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelGuy_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday while visiting family. This was my first time at this Hilton. I was very impressed with the staff and their friendliness. They appeared to go out of their way to be helpful. The room was quiet and nicely furnished. Nothing opulent, but for the price it was a good value. The location is a bit remote for some, I would say. I would agree with another reviewer who objected to the $14 per night parking charge, but that's the going rate for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Painfully blah hotel”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: Another Priceline find. For $55/night, it ain't bad, but if I booked full price and thought I was getting a Hilton hotel, I'd be very disappointed. Location is terrible (it's near nothing) and yet they charge $14/night for parking. Internet is not free. And the hotel is just so blah everywhere else... no plasmas in the room. Our room was laid out super weird, with the TV on the side of the bed. Very uncomfortable to watch. If it wasn't so close to my wedding destination, I probably would have stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “NO Executive lounge anymore, not noted on Web Site! Huge CC block!"”
Reviews.Author: killbondnow
Reviews.Content: I am a HHonors Diamond x 5 years running, looked forward to staying here for a meeting that was held at another non-Hilton hotel. Was not informed that the executive lounge is *permanently* shut until arrival (there was NO mention of this on the web site, or I would not have selected this hotel). Received upgrade to exec floor, but, really, big whoop. Gave us coupons for a free appetizer at the sports bar (in lieu of the exec lounge perqs), but I frankly don't equate a sports bar appetizer as quite the same thing... Worse, the executive level rooms had recent water damage visible on the ceiling from the recent rains. When I checked in, I was told that they would block a MANDATORY $50 PER DAY for incidentals from my card -- really, there isn't $50 a day worth of ANYTHING at this hotel. Getting more and more frustrated with "meh" service/amenities and lack of real Diamond perqs here, so wanted to call and move to the Doubletree right across the freeway. Cell phone dead, didn't want to incur huge phone charges, so I went downstairs. No phone in lobby, business center or even by the meeting rooms. Asked front desk, and they said if I wanted to call I'd have to go to the CONVENIENCE STORE NEXT DOOR, that was the nearest public phone. That was IT! We moved out an hour after check-in, very unhappy with this property. The funny thing was they tried to explain, "Well, if it was a local call, we could have let you done it from here." Well, yeah, um, I really don't think they would have wanted their other guests to hear what I had to say during that call, frankly... anyway the Doubletree welcomed us with open happy arms WITH a wonderful executive lounge, WITH expanded breakfast buffet and lovely exec lounge evening service (food & drink), WITH a nicely upgraded room, WITH warm cookies, and WITH a quiet elegant bar, outdoor firepit and lovely personnel. THAT is Diamond treatment I'm used to! The only good thing I have to say about the Hilton Mission Valley is that the manager "Amy" facilitated the quick resolution of the block off my credit (not debit) card, which was STILL on hold 3 days after I arrived, which I think is ridiculous. And that $50 a day, sheesh! There is NOTHING there worth $50 a day! I'll never even this consider this Hilton again, and it takes a LOT to make me scratch off a potential point-maker!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: WishIWasInHawaiiNow
Reviews.Content: Does not offer extravagant amenities, but the rooms were clean and located close to amusement partks. We asked for a quieter room, which faced the hill behind the hotel (no view), but better than facing the freeway. We got a special package that included parking and breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome B and B Package”
Reviews.Author: BeachbabeCali
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly. We booked adjacent rooms for our family (he have two little kids under 5)and we were comfortable. The breakfast included in our rate was excellent. Parking was also part of the package which made the package very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: kammil
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel, very well appointed rooms, clean and spacious. Check in and check out ("zip-out") was very smooth as well. The location was not that great (in terms of amenities), one definitely needs to drive around if you wanna go places, but parking is rather inexpensive ($14 self parking per day). I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hilton, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TheWinger
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 3 night stay here, and all in all it was ok. The great rate I received through the Visa Infinite deal made it worthwhile. The room I was in was on the 10th floor facing the hill and was pretty average, a bit worn but the bed was very comfortable. The executive lounge is closed down (cost issues) and they are handing out coupons for breakfast and coupons for an appetizer and a non alcoholic drink for each day. Pool was small. Valet parking was $18/day and internet is free for Diamond members. We did enjoy the location which was very close to everything, and a short walk to the mall on the other side of the highway which had plenty of dining options. I would probably stay here again if the rate was decent, but will probably look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: lacadude
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for Labor Day weekend because it was a Hilton. Unfortunately, this is not your typical Hilton, it's more like a Motel 6. For one, the rooms are noisy. The hotel faces I-8 so you hear the freeway traffic. Also, the walls are thin so you hear your neighbors, including their barking dogs because this hotel allows pets. Secondly, the rooms are not clean. The carpet in our room looked dirty and had a nasty stain on it. This dirtiness applies to the entire hotel in general. Finally, the breakfast buffet that they advertise is nothing more than a continental breakfast with eggs, sausage/bacon, and potatoes, and looks nothing like what's pictured on their website. There are plenty of other hotels near this hotel that might be better choices but I cannot vouch for them as I have not stayed at any of them. But based on my stay here, I will not be staying at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: imken504
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and were very pleased. We stayed on the executed floor and really enjoyed the breakfast. The breakfast was better than other hilton hotels we have stayed. In addition to the typical continental breakfast items, it also included bacons, sausages, scramble eggs, selections of tea and beaverage. Our kids really enjoyed the breakfast every morning. The room was clean and quiet. The beds were comfortable. The location worked very well for us. It had easy access to freeways and was within 15-20 minutes to most of the places we wanted to visit. We didn't spend much time at the hotel though, as there were too many exciting things to do and see in and around San Diego. Therefore, I cannot comment on other hotel services and amenities. I cannot offer comments on their WiFi and parking charges either as the hotel offered those services to me free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to "executive" floor was worth it”
Reviews.Author: AZFamilyOf4
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for three days and were very pleased. We paid about $10 a night extra to stay on the executive floor in order to get the included breakfast. We were only expecting a typical continental breakfast, but this hotel included extras like bacon, sausage, and scrambled eggs. The hostess even told us with advance notice the chef could prepare special items to accommodate food allergies. Our room was a bit small, but it was very clean and comfortable, with a nice flat panel TV in it. The double beds were comfortable, but would be better if they were queen size. The air conditioning was easily adjustable and kept the temperature just right. Inroom WiFi is available and provided free to HHonors members. Some reviewers have complained about noise, but that was not a problem during our stay. Perhaps that is due to being on the executive floor, or maybe it was just due to staying midweek while the hotel was less crowded. Either way, we never had a problem with this. The inland location worked great for us, though we were thankful for GPS as navigating the area can be a little tricky. San Diego zoo, Balboa Park, Sea World, and beaches are all about 15 minutes away. Overall, we would recommend this hotel for its clean, comfortable rooms, nice included breakfast (on executive floor), and central location.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep, don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: lkepes
Reviews.Content: The walls are made from paper and I could hear EVERYTHING that was going on next door. And trust me, I didn't want to!!! The place seemed dirty and was not a great place for kids. The crib they gave us for our baby to sleep in had rust on the sides. It was an awful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not to Hilton standards.”
Reviews.Author: wacaj
Reviews.Content: There are positives about this hotel, but more bigger negatives about this Hilton hotel that have left an unpleasant taste about my stay. Pros: central location and easy to get everywhere in the San Diego area; the breakfast buffet was OK, and didn't charge my seven year old son (he looks and eats small). Cons: $14/day for self serve parking was just a "cash grab"; the shower and tub took forever to drain; housekeeping knocked on the door at 8:30 am on Sunday wanting to know when I would leave so she could clean the room. HUGE Con: I had to ask for pool towels four times, taking over an hour to finally receive them. When asked, the Guest Services representative at the front desk could not explain the delay, but did agree that I was paying for a "full service hotel". The duty manager agreed to "look into" the problem, but did little to improve the customer service as they "fell short of my expectation". The hotel manager/GM was useless and made no attempt to make change my experience at his hotel (a reflection of leadership?).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Food, Beaches, Freeway, etc. There are some Things to Watch For Though! DO READ!”
Reviews.Author: 102710f
Reviews.Content: I booked a great room at the Hilton by going to the official website and using my AAA discount. I booked it two weeks in advance to avoid the busy eventful weekend bookings to come. The hotel is located right off of the freeway. It is located near a great mall, grocery store, fast food, and other shopping goodies. The workout room is quite large and lovely as well. Plenty of exercise equipment, cold towels, and adjustable temps. Large portions with room service meals as well. Now What to Watch For! *Noise- Yes the walls are thin and you can hear kids screaming down the halls or above you (one morning heard a Banshee of a child screaming about something), but it is really more of a timing issue. By the weekend I found the hotel to be quiet oddly enough. I even had a back facing room towards the trees (two weeks in advance booking on official website) Bring some earplugs and you should get a restful night's sleep! The reviews on here aren't lying! I was prepared for it just in case. *Bed Bugs-Yes all hotels have bed bugs, even the nice ones! The beds are comfortable though and luckily didn't get bitten, but I do make sure to do most of my sleeping on top of the covers. Bed bugs like to hide in drawers, under picture frames, in mattress seams, and anywhere else they know they can get to a host for feeding. Make sure to always check the mattress seams wherever you stay! Always keep suitcases away from the beds. Keeping them on the desk or suitcase fold out are wise choices. You don't want to bring back any critters with you. *Parking-Parking is $14 dollars a day whether your leave or stay in. It's worth the cost though if you want easy access to the freeway for events N and S. You must visit Balboa Park and La Jolla Cove! *Internet-$9.95 for 24 hour use. Only recommend it if you want to touch base with someone or do some research. It's not worth it though. Overall the Hilton Mission Valley is not a bad place to stay for a nice visit to San Diego. I will probably look to stay closer to the water next time around, but it's not bad with the right room for just sleeping aka earplugged up.

Reviews.Title: “Just a regular hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dmc37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights at this hotel using my Hilton Honors points. Pros: 1. Good location to get around. Close to shopping. Places to eat. Activities. 2. Nice, clean room. Large LCD. Fridge. Desk. Free Wifi. 3. Since we stayed on Executive Floor. Free breakfast (bacon, eggs, sausage, etc.) Cons: 1. No free parking. Just didn't feel right about this Hilton hotel charging $14 per day for parking. 2. Probably not their fault because maybe it wasn't available but my room preference was not given to us. We wanted a king bed away from the elevator. I would stay at this hotel again but only if I was using Hilton Honor points.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hilton for the price, but would not stay here again if I had the choice”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: Got a room here for $67 a night using priceline. Was trying for the Doubletree Mission Valley, but no luck. This Hilton is located right next to the freeway and is pretty easy to find. But the hotel does not give you the feeling of San Diego. I would recommend staying closer to Old Town, Downtown, or the bay. The Mission Valley area is only worth it if you need to be in the area or you can find a really nice hotel. The Doubletree is much nicer and located next to the trolley station. The first room we received smelt awful in the restroom, which was because someone forgot to flush after using it (Gross). They happily moved us and the room was okay, nothing great. The bed was nice and soft, but I just didn't care fort the Hilton. Parking is another problem of this hotel, $14 a night! OUCH.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lisann
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Mission Valley was perfect for our trip. The room was very clean and roomy. The interior spaces were lovely and the location central to our needs. The pool was clean and heated and there were towels on each chair plus plenty more in a chest on the pool deck. Check in was smooth, especialy with our multiple rooms. We were able to check in early and all of our rooms were on the same floor and close together. The front desk person was very helpful with messy credit card problem. Using priceline made the Hilton very affordable, otherwise we would not have stayed there. The only drawback was having to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not really the Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: BostonBrrr
Reviews.Content: Service was not great. We arrived at midnight, and I was struggling with four bags while my wife was struggling with our over-tired 3 year old daughter, but no one offerred to help us with our bags, the door or the elevators. Maybe that is the Hilton standard these days, but I expected better. Location of the hotel is pretty awful. It is on the service road of a major highway (I-8) and the traffic noise is constant even on the 6th floor. But that was only the start. There is a water hammer problem in this hotel. Whenever anyone in any room (it seems) turns on or off the water there is a loud banging sound. The plumbing woes continue with a very inconsistent water pressure and temperature. You will be taking a shower and suddenly the pressure drops and the temperature jumps up to scalding hot or falls to freezing cold (I guess it depends on whether your neighbor opened up the hot or cold taps). We only had breakfast in the restaurant. It was pretty expensive. $40 for two buffets. Children are free at the buffet, but my daughter likes her eggs done a particular way which was not on the buffet, so boom, another $10. They also don't have whole milk, which is all my daughter would drink. There is no mini-bar refrigerator in the rooms either so no way to keep milk even if you buy it. This was a major hassle for us. The coffee maker in the room malfunctioned, and they didn't replenish the supplies anyway. The last straw was the business center. The wait to use a computer was more than 30 minutes all the time. I went down at 6am hoping it would be better, but so did half a dozen other people. Even when you do get on, the other waiting guest are looking over your shoulder and trying to get you to hurry up. I wish I had taken the laptop, but who needs another thing to carry when you are travelling with a toddler.

Reviews.Title: “In Need of Major Updating”
Reviews.Author: CARose
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a business trip March 2009. I go to this area often and usually stay at the Double Tree - Mission Valley. Was not able to get a room. As a Diamond member, I secured and confirmed my room on the executive floor the day prior to my arrival. When I checked in, I presented my e-check in confirmation with the assigned room number on the executive floor. The agent presented my keys and proceeded up to my room. Half way up on the elevator; I looked in my package and noticed I was now on a room on another floor. My original room number had been crossed out (it was the confirmed room number from my e-check in). I went back down to the front desk to ask why my room had been changed, not to mention that the agent never informed me of this change when I checked in and proceeded up to the floor I thought I was on. The agent apologized and stated that the floor of my room number was also considered an executive floor. I stated that I understood, but as a benefit of being a Diamond member is to secure a room prior to check in only to have it changed, what is the purpose of this benefit. He stated that my original room was available and gave me new keys to that room. Room - Very average/basic - especially for a room on the executive floor. Very small, old out dated furniture. Other reviews are accurate about the state of the rooms. Turned on the TV, wouldn't turn on. The batteries were dead in the remote. Turned on the TV manually, the closed caption was on and could not be manually turned off. Called the front desk, they informed me that someone from facilities would be right up with batteries. Approx 40 mins later, the front desk called to see if facilities had been up to my room. I stated no, they said they would call again. 10 minutes later, someone came to the room. Took approx., 50 mins. Not much else to say other than it was a very average room, comfortable bed, nothing special for an executive floor. Executive Lounge - Very nice. Evening service had honor bar, fridge stocked with sodas and water. A couple of hot items and desserts. Lounge was better than most I've stayed at State side. Am service was equally good. No complaints. Parking Charge - Standard at most Hilton properties. Location - Central to downtown, La Jolla. Close to shopping and restaurants. Gym - Very outdated. All Hilton's I've stayed at in the last year, the gyms have all new equipment. This equipment was very old, worn. No water cooler but a sign that states a water fountain is in the hallway. Overall - Very average stay, you can do much better. Would not recommend for a stay of 3 days or greater.

Reviews.Title: “Lacks basic necessaties”
Reviews.Author: bethesdaman
Reviews.Content: The staff is very, very friendly. However, I wouldn't recommend staying at the Hilton Mission Valley hotel because it lacks basic necessities. For example: the air conditioner does not work properly. I had mine set on 65 my entire stay, but it felt 75. I had several clients who were staying at this property and their room temperature was on the warmer side. The water pressure fluctuates from high pressure to low pressure every couple of minutes. Again, I had clients complain about the water pressure as well. Even though the entire hotel is "smoke free", people were smoking in their rooms and in the hallway. The hotel should have attempted to enforce the no-smoking policy. The rooms are outdated. The 19inch tube TV is a thing of the past. No channel guide is provided either. My room had hair all over the bathroom, hair on bathroom towels, and hair on pillows on the beds. The hotel is pet friendly. A colleague had to change rooms because of a loud, barking dog next door. I would assume that the complaints about bed bugs on here relate to the amount of pets staying on property here. I saw three dogs when I was checking in. Self parking is $14 and valet is $18 a night. Internet is $9.95 per night unless you have status (silver and higher) at Hilton. Other nearby hotels provide shuttles to the airport. This Hilton property does not offer any type of shuttle service. Cab rides are around $20 to/from the hotel and airport. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Nicer Hiltons - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Amperage
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Hilton. Lovely lobby, nice rooms and comfy. The hotel rooms are freshly updated and LARGE. The location is excellent and the price is appropriate. The staff is courteous and housekeeping is prompt and thorough. I have absolutely no complains, only praise for this hotel at this point, sitting as I am, watching the city of San Diego from my hotel room here at the Hilton. Now then, onto another matter. I'm amazed at the other reviewers for this hotel who claim to visit hotels (and even Hilton hotels!) regularly yet are downgrading this hotel for charging for parking and internet access. These are typical charges for Hiltons. In the Hilton hotels, all Hiltons, Embassy Suites and Doubletrees charge for internet access and most of the Hiltons charge for parking, depending upon environment. It is what it is, UCR. The hotel is great for a business traveller in need of a place to relax after a long day at work. If I had any complaints, it would be that in the exercise room, the exercise machines do not have individual TV screens attached to the machines.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: travelerMBoulder_CO
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and am rather picky about hotels. I felt that it is an EXCELLENT place to stay. The rooms are nicely appointed, the AC works well, it is quiet and the staff is fabulous. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS BEDS BUGS”
Reviews.Author: maddymoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, because it was close to the location of my business trip - I would never stay there again. Rooms were dingy and BED BUGS were in the first room we stayed at. The second room they gave us the sheets were still dirty and had makeup on the pillows. I asked for our clothes to be completely laundered so we donâ€™t take bed bugs home - the clothes were returned in the same dirty garbage bag they gave us to put the clothes in and upon returning half the clothes was damp and it was thrown back in the bag unfolded.....

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good...Typical Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Pharmrep79
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Hilton hotel. It is pretty good, but not as much as you would expect. I am a Hilton Diamond member, and I am loyal to the Hilton company, but the Hilton brand could use some work to offer more value. One example at this property is that you have to pay for internet use. This seems to be antiquated and shows that Hilton is out of touch with business travelers. This property is no exception. Luckily, on this trip I was traveling for leisure. The parking fee is kind of ridiculous as well. I understand that parking is at a premium, but why not just have a reader at the barrier that reads your room key and raises the barrier if you are a guest? Making guests pay outrageous fees for parking is not the way to show that you are looking out for guests and creating a good relationship. I booked through Priceline, so the parking was ok, but if I had to pay full price I wouldn't book. The rooms are ok. In fact they are pretty nice, with nice beds. Our shower also had pressure that changed many times throughout the course of a shower. The temperature seemed to change in response to the pressure changes. The staff at the front desk was EXCELLENT. This is the biggest and best feature of this hotel. In a way this makes almost any negative forgettable. Hotel managers did you read those last three sentences? Please take note, service is the most important part of any hotel (I should know I spend half a year, each year, in a hotel). This hotel doesn't have the best location, but it is bearable. Unless, you really like Denny's, don't expect to walk to eat out many times. This hotel is a solid choice for the price, if you can get a discount. Even at full price, it is competitive in the region. There are many better hotels on the waterfront, but they are very high priced. This is relatively close to most things, is bearable, has a nice look and a good staff. It is a good choice for those with a car, and who want a basic, but nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HIgh hopes followed by frustration, but a happy ending”
Reviews.Author: hobo6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live only about a mile or two from this hotel. My wife chose this hotel to be the place to stay the night before our wedding, the location to prepare herself for the wedding, and hotel to spend our first married night together. The whole experience did not begin or transpire well until the end. We made the mistake of waiting until two weeks before the wedding to actually view our room. We were very disappointed with the size of the room. Not only would it be cramped for two people, but there was no way she could have her bridal party and hairdresser in the room, much less have space to hang her wedding dress. The only larger room would be the presidential suite or joining rooms. The presidential suite was huge, however it had a queen sized murphy bed. We choose the presidential suite. The staff at the front desk were not sure if we could change our room to the presidential suite since we had reserved the room through Travelocity. As a result we had to call back the next day. The manager said it would be no problem. However, it would cost us an addition $50 a day. We took the new room. My bride to be returned to her room the night before the wedding to find the TV remote not working. Someone came up with new batteries. She always reads in bed before she goes to sleep to relax herself. Before getting into bed she realized the light bulbs above the Murphy Bed were out. Again, someone came to replace the bulbs. Prior to getting into bed she knelt down to pray and was disgusted when she found the sheets to be dirty and look like their were a couple of bugs. This is when I received a frantic call at about 12am the morning before we were to be wed. She said she could not sleep in the room with the bed the way it was and that they were going to move all of her stuff to another presidential suite on another floor. I said that was ridiculous. I suggested the management open the attached room to the presidential suite to us at no extra cost. They obliged. When we returned from our wedding reception we were greeted with a bottle of champaign and chocolate covered strawberries as a gesture of regret by the hotel. I thought it was a nice touch. The following morning we ordered room service. We ordered tea, berries and cream, along with a couple of crossaints. We had to call room service back when we discovered they gave us coffee and forgot the cream to go with the berries. Lastly, we received the bill and were charged for an additional night of parking. When we checked we were not charged for the additional room, for no parking, nor our room service breakfast. Although things did not go according to plan, in the end, as a result of the staff, everything worked out. We had a larger room than we could have imagined and a wonderful wedding. I also want to add that guests of our wedding also stayed at the hotel and had an enjoyable stay. I would recommend the hotel, but not the murphy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel . . . Not the Best, Not the Worst”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4Fun
Reviews.Content: Minor Problems: I stayed here for over a week for a conference being held at the hotel. When I checked in, my reservation was wrong but they quickly fixed the problem. My first room was very clean. Unfortunately, the water pressure in the shower was not very good to start with and then it would back way off once you had soap in your hair. I tried to deal with it for the first few days and tried to shower earlier or later than the usual rush, but it didn't matter. The staff told me that they have trouble with the pressure and that the water comes from a main line in the middle of the building so if you're close to the middle you have better pressure. The hotel was very accommodating and switched my luggage while I was at the conference that day. The second room was better but it still had the same problems (and a dirty toilet!). Once the toilet was cleaned, I was set for the rest of my stay. The A/C did not work very well in either room - the room would cool to 75 degrees even though the thermostat was set as low as it could go. Housekeeping kept the room clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and there were always fresh towels. Although the hotel just underwent a renovation, the rooms still look rather dated . . . especially the bathroom. The white tile in the shower looks very old. The furniture and rug were in good condition though - just dated. The location -- there is an 8 lane highway in between you and other restaurants and shopping. You can get to the other places but you have to walk two blocks to the light, cross the bridge over the freeway and a little further to get there. I suppose you could drive too. It's about a 1.5 mile walk to the Mission Valley trolley stop. Otherwise, there isn't much by the hotel -- you are limited to a Japanese Steakhouse, Dennys, Wendys or a Beni-Hanna on the hotel-side of the freeway. Relation to Downtown: You have to catch the trolley to downtown San Diego. The trolley is very cheap and relatively easy to use. It has a color coded map. You can buy a 2 hour pass ($2.50) or a day pass ($5). The hotel is about a $20 taxi ride from the Zoo. And about $25 to the airport by taxi. My understanding is that the beaches and La Jolla are about a 10-15 minute car ride from the hotel. As usual, the Hilton charges you for everything. $9.95 a day for internet (you can only purchase daily, not hourly). The restaurant in the hotel is very expensive but the food is decent. The lobby had fun decorations. The hotel had a pool -- I didn't use it. The fitness room was very crowded - they basically turned two hotel rooms into the fitness room. It had the usual equipment. The hotel was good enough for a business traveler. If you plan to tour San Diego, you might want to stay at a hotel closer to the city or make sure you have a rental car and are willing to pay the expensive parking fees. Alternatively, bring a good pair of walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for five nights. Found the Hilton very adequate, but not spectacular. Skipped the $16.95 breakfast buffet for the $5.99 Grand Slam at Denny's just down the road. Room was average sized but skimpy on drawers for clothes with just three. Room thermostat seemed to be 5-7 degrees off. Water pressure in shower seemed to come and go in cycles and bathroom could use a fan.. Did like the Evelyn & Crabtree toiletries and thick towels. Bell staff/parking valets were very friendly and helpful. Location is good for various San Diego activites. I guess I expect Hiltons to be exceptional properties. This one seems to lack character and would be easily forgotten by most travelers. This was my first Hilton stay in some time and I think in the future I'll stick with a DoubleTree, where you get a bigger bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Was very clean and seemed pretty new. The elevator to the parking garage smells a little funky but otherwise is okay. I wish Hilton wouldn't nickel and dime so much. It was $14/night to park and $10/day PER LAPTOP per night for wi-fi. The business center costs were outrageous. I sent a two page fax to an 800 number and it cost $5. The internet access in the business center was equally expensive. We received the government discount so the rate was very good so our value for the money was good. I didn't eat there because the prices were very high. Overall, the room was nice and the front desk staff were helpful but all the additional fees are annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom23ingt
Reviews.Content: Good hotel stay. Clean rooms and very comfortable beds. Staff was nice. Was a little disappointed when I asked for extra towels to take to the beach and was told they do not allow towels to go off property. This seems a little absurd since San Diego is on the coast with the beach readily available. Being an honest person, I just went to the pool and helped myself to the towels and returned them to the room each evening. Everything else was fine. Was charged for internet access that was done at the pool (told by front desk that poolside was free), but this was quickly taken off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Loreli55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for a weekend, but it seemed much shorter than that. The stay was the most pleasant stay we could have asked for. The staff was very courteous and helpful and the hotel itself was very clean. Our room was nice and we both slept very well in our Kingsized bed. For breakfast we were just expecting a few choices, but it ended up to be a lovely continental spread with cereals, bagels, fruit pastries, etc. You could even upgrade to "hot food" which included waffles, eggs, bacon, etc for an extra $5.00, which we thought was quite reasonable. All-in-all we highly recommend this hotel no matter how long your stay will be in the San Diego area. You're close to most everything and, again, the staff is there to please.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here if it weren't for a conference”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithRiley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a conference. Wouldn't choose this location if I were a tourist or looking for a place to relax. Here are the pluses & minuses: Plus - Wonderful complementary breakfast selection for Hilton Honors Gold Members - Clean room - Comfortable bed & pillows - shopping center on the other side of the freeway - In-room fridge - Pets allowed Minus - The location is not that great. There are many other better locations & with better prices. - Paper-thin walls; heard the shower from 1 floor up & doors slamming down the hall - Difficult to view TV as it doesn't pull out from the cabinet - Business center charges for Internet access - Self-parking was $14; valet was $18 per day - Small pool The restaurant, Stish, has terrible food with fancy restaurant prices. No one in the party of 3 liked the food. Seabass was overcooked. Jambalaya had strange cream-base sauce instead of tomato-base sauce.

Reviews.Title: “Not a RESORT”
Reviews.Author: melindajirwin
Reviews.Content: Easy access to freeway and lots of chain restaurants on the other side of the freeway. There is also a mall and the trolley stop across the freeway. It is at least a 15 minute walk to the trolley stop ( I walk fast) Took me over an hour to get downtown. Small pool, small fitness center, no spa/salon - not sure why they call it a resort? We were with a large group and we had lots of problems with the elevators. Rooms were nice-hard to see TV from bed as it didn't slide out of armoire. Probably wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you got a cheap price and always planned on driving everywhere. I reallly think Mission Bay or Gaslight District would be preferrable to stay to see the sights of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: califclasy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that has recently been updated. It is slightly hard to get to if you are not used to the freeway system in San Diego, but is close to everything. About 20 minutes or less to Sea World, Old Town, Gaslamp Quarter. Their restaurant is a bit upscale, so we skipped it. Denny's is 1/2 block away and there are other places not far. Parking was $14/day with an in-out pass. The parking is underground with lobby entrance. The staff is very polite and helpful. We asked for extra shampoo and it was delivered while we were out. Rooms are very nice. We did not hear anyone else throughout our stay. Nice and quiet. Although I prefer breakfast on the premises, I would stay here again. Went for 2 nights with my daughter and granddaughter. We had a great time and felt totally safe coming in late at night after sight seeing. Enjoyed the privacy of entering hotel without having to walk through the lobby. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, just fine for a base camp!”
Reviews.Author: OregonMomoftwo
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of reviews and was a little hesitant when we ended up with this hotel through priceline ($75 a night bid). We were looking for something at Hotel Circle, but would rather spend our money exploring not hanging out in a hotel room. We were pleasantly surprised. Valet parking guys were kind and helpful even though we made clear we were not using their services. We easily found parking on the street (car sales lot next door). Our stay was Mon - Sat (not sure if Sat/Sun night are busier). Reception was fine and they had nice fruit ice water in lobby. Room was fine...great big towels, nice toiletries, nothing too remarkable. Rooms had fridge. We were on a budget and didn't do room service or eat there. Pool was small and in shade...too cold for us. Probably fine in summer. Exercise room was good enough for a work out. Nothing too fancy (3-4 bikes, 3 cross trainers, 1.5 treadmills - one treadmill had half the tread). So, no complaints here. Great central location and friendly staff. Decor in rooms was fine. Lobby was kinda odd shades of green with a hideous red chandelier. Not sure what they were going for.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying in”
Reviews.Author: EKLHRVS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Misson Valley last week. The hotel is OK to find and once you navigate the car park quite easy to find the check in. The receptionists were polite and efficient. The rooms were the type we reserved and we were allocated the 8th Floor. The rooms are average, but needed some TLC as the bathroom sliding door would not shut and the hand towel rail in the bathroom fell off daily! The shower had good pressure though and the bathroom /room in general was clean. The only drawback with the room was that the walls are THIN, you can hear everything in the corridor and the neighbours room besides you and above you! The pool area was nice with a jacuzzi and smallish pool but big enough for the people staying there. The only sad thing is the $14 per night car parking fee - $18 for valet parking. felt this was quite steep. There is a shopping centre opposite within walking distance and if you want a great breakfast then head to Mimi's. We were advised to avoid the buffet breakfast in the hotel - so cannot comment on the quality of the food. Overall the hotel is close to Seaworld and a reasonable hotel for the price paid. Would stay there again if we could get the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the worst Hilton yet”
Reviews.Author: USKiwiTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hilton Diamond member I stayed at this property in Q'01, 2008 for a meeting which I was holding. The writing was on the wall as to the poor customer service I had received from the Event Coordinator. She was lackadaisical at best and really provided me with the worst experience that Iâ€™ve ever had coordinating a meeting at a hotel! The Hotel itself on a scale of 1 â€“ 10 was a 5, at best. The check-in was adequate though they did not have a room prepared even though I had requested an early check-in. The room itself was â€œokayâ€�, nothing special but clean so canâ€™t complain. The only plus was I had a room facing the mountains as had read previous reviews on the noise from the freeways keeping people awake. I had the same comment said to me from some of my team during their stay. I had access to the Executive lounge in the mornings due to my Hilton Status and again, was very disappointed. The selection of breakfast foods was marginal at best, and the coffee (all the mornings) was the weakest Iâ€™ve ever had at a Hilton property in the US. I never ate at the restaurant so canâ€™t comment. Did have pre-dinner cocktails though and found the bar to be modern (but small) with a friendly bartender. As you can guess, for me, this was a rather poor experience. I picked this Hilton as it looked nice on line & thought it may have that â€œextra bit of service etc.â€� not being in proper San Diego, sadly I was wrong. My suggestion would be to not stay at this property, and to spend the extra $20- $40 it takes to stay at one of the other Hilton properties in San Diego. It was quite the miserable experience for my team & me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For A Quick Stayover”
Reviews.Author: Bigmonkey13
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from business trip in San Diego, where I stayed at the Hilton San Diego Mission Valley. The hotel was in a nice location, within walking distance to several chain restaurants and stores. It is easily accessible to the major highways in the area, allowing one to get around the city fairly quickly. The room I stayed at on the 11th floor was extremely clean and well kept. Everytime I interacted with the staff, be it front desk, room service, etc, I found them to be helpful and courteous. The one complaint that I had is that I found their in-room wireless internet to be unreliable. I spent around an hour on the phone with their technical support and still couldn't get reliable service. All in all, though, I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice - Value and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Jeter2010
Reviews.Content: I had a two week business trip. I was having trouble getting a reasonable rate on a local hotel and so the Hilton reservations agent was nice enough to check all the Hilton brands around the same area to see what was available in my price range. Upon arrival, the front desk clerks were extremely helpful and friendly. The lounge serves great appetizers and a filling breakfast with great staff that run the room. The room is the usual Hilton great condition and great bedding. I would stay here again the next time in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: ynguy
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for its central location not for the location it is in ( hotel circle ). As it was very quiet I did not have any problems with parking but I can see when the hotel is busy it can be a tight squeeze. The rooms are tiny which was somewhat disappointing. The decor was ok ish. Something new , something old ( tv's are antiquated). I would certainly recommend taking a room at the back of the house as the rooms facing Mission valley and Interstate 8 are noisy. One can hear the constant din of the traffic. Fitness room seemed out of order and I could not find the sauna. I had breakfast once in hotel and it was so so. Waiting staff seemed nice enough. Front Office staff seemed ok but once the requests are just a touch out of the ordinary much less helpful. I paid a rate of $ 105 so that was not bad at all and for this rate I would stay here again but if rate would be more than $ 139 I would give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, but less than expected”
Reviews.Author: jek134
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at this hotel because a friend gushed about the location. It was nice, but I guess I expected more. We had a standard room with a great view of the fireworks from Sea World (an unexpected surprise). The room itself seemed dusty and my husband and I both commented on how we didn't feel the place was clean. We figured it was because we were so close to the beach (bay). It's not that the place wasn't kept up by housekeeping, we just both had the FEELING that it wasn't as clean as other hotel rooms in which we'd stayed. The decor of the room was okay - they went for a cool modern look with dark furniture and light blue accents. You could tell that the hotel was older and that they had refurbished it. The walls were paper thin. This was the first time I'd slept at a hotel where we could hear EVERYTHING outside our door plus the footsteps of those above us. My husband and I were surprised. We had breakfast at the hotel and that was quite nice. We sat outside on their patio. I had the buffet and my husband ordered off of the menu. The buffet is very similar to one you'd get for free at Embassy Suites, but without the omelette bar. Nice fresh fruit. The pools were nice. I especially loved the little toddler pool as we had our two children ages 2 and 4 with us. It was a foot and a half deep so we didn't really have to worry, but there were leaves and debris everywhere in the pool. It seemed unkempt. Other mothers commented on this as well. The location was nice. Very close to Sea World where we had gone for the day. The bay was right there, though it seemed dirty. We stayed there in July when the weather was great, but the bay looked dark and gray, not bright blue where you'd want to go for a swim. It was still nice to walk along the sand, however. There was also a lot of things to do such as rent bicycles, kayaks, floating devices, volleyball, etc, but as we had the kids with us, we didn't do any of them. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel, but I guess my expectations were a little too high. I would probably stay there again, but not before I tried a few more hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Reekas_Travels77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a few days. It is right off the 5, so the location was excellent for getting to all the San Diego attractions quickly. Service and staff were excellent. We had no issues with the stay. We loved out room - it was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The bed was amazing - super comfy! We also used the business center which was in the lobby area and had no issues there. My only minor complaint would be that parking is not free. It's $14/night to park in their garage. Over all, it was an excellent stay. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only queen beds for handicap room..what bs!!!”
Reviews.Author: sushiqueen
Reviews.Content: If you want a handicap accessible room you can only get one with queen bed. THAT IS BS Looking for a good place to stay night before charger game. I read all the good reviews on Hilton ( compared to other hotels in the area ) . We are big time Marriot customers but they are sold out the night we need. So, searching for another hotel..based on price and reviews I chose to book at Hilton!!!! I hate hotels that do that. Very unfair and frustrating. If you are physically challenged, you should have choices like everyone else. Do hotels think disabled patrons are traveling alone and dont have the right to a king or at min 2 queens!! BS!!!! I asked why the said their handicap rooms are small!1 Gee that's nice..we get crappy rooms and only 1 queen bed along with it

Reviews.Title: “Clean - Nice Decor - Excellent Staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Stacy12
Reviews.Content: Located in Mission Valley right off of Interstate 8. You are close to Qualcomm Stadium, the mall (with many nice eat in restaurants). 10 minutes from downtown & Balboa Park. The room was very nice. Very clean. We had a room overlooking Mission Valley and it was very quiet. No traffic noise at all. The bed was comfortable and comes with extra pillows & down comforter. Parking was $14 a day. A 10% gratituity is automatically added to room service. The staff is excellent. Always a smile and ready to assist with whatever you need. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: aznate27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July with a friend of mine while in San Diego for Pride, booking a 2 queen on the executive level. The hotel has a contemperary feel to it that extended from the lobby to the restaurant to the room. Our room was nice and very clean. I do wish I would have requested a room at the front of the hotel though. We were 12 stories up in the back of the hotel which had nothing more than the hill that rises above the hotel for a view. The front would have given us a nice city view. As far as location goes, this is a great hotel. We were just a short cab ride from Hillcrest where all the Pride celebrations were, as well as where most of the bars and clubs were located. It's also located fairly close to downtown, the airport, and Sea World. There are several shopping centers located just on the other side of the highway across from the hotel, as well as a number of restaurants located close by to suit everyone's taste. We did eat at Stish, the restaurant located in the hotel. The food was good, but a bit over priced, but what hotel food isn't! The lobster bisk was awesome! Our room did come with a lite breakfast. We opted to spend the extra $5 more ( a day ) each for the full buffet, which was ok as far as breakfast food goes. For the most part the staff was very friendly and attentive. We did have a problem with requesting a cab and getting towncars instead, which on one night turned into a mess! We took this up with Drew, the front desk supervisor, and he was kind enough to take off our parking fee for our stay. Being $14 a day to park, that was more than enough to make up for their mistake. Everything else was fine. Good fitness room, pool, and free internet downstairs in the lobby and restaurant ( $9.95 in room). I'll definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding guests loved it!”
Reviews.Author: steviemagid
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our daughter's wedding and had over 30 rooms reserved for our guests. Everyone was very pleased with their accommodations, the service, and the location. The staff in the sales department helped with all the plans, gave us good rates for our guests, and generally took care of all of our needs. The rooms are first rate-good beds, sheets, pillows, coffee maker, and nice toiletries. Only drawback was the parking was pricey. Didn't eat at the restaurant, but I heard that it was expensive. Plenty of places to eat in the area. We would definitely return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thetractorman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a major conference held downtown. The property is well-maintained and the staff was most courteous. There are many restaurants nearby, and you can catch the Trolley about a 15 minute walk away to ride downtown. If you have a car, I-8 is right out front and you can easily find your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Mission Valley”
Reviews.Author: MicSte
Reviews.Content: Nice standard Hilton property; rooms were well appointed marble baths, new wallpaper; Highway side wasn't noisy like others state- they must be hyper. Restaurant for breakfast was expensive- $55 for two. Luckily we had coupons from Hilton upgrades for at least one morning- the HHonors lounge wasn't open on weekends - basic buffet..nothing really special. Didn't try dinner why when so much else in town. Small business center but servicable. Really in middle of nowhere although since we had car could get to anywhere within 10-15 minutes ...really. Would have preferred to stay in town at Hilton Gaslight if I had known more about city and could have gotten the same rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Vis2020
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on a Saturday night via PL for $55. Needless to say at that price it did not take much more to make me happy. However, upon arrival to this hotel, I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel. The lobby was cozy and comfortable. Our room was very clean and well appointed. The double bed was very comfortable. We stayed on the third floor right next to the vending/ice machine (probably their standard PL room), but did not encounter much noise all night. Given the price we booked the hotel for on a Weekend, I absolutely have nothing to complain about! Even the $14 parking fee!

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Hilton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ariz0nian
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel extremely clean, very quiet and comfortable, almost new like. The hotel lobby seemed very small. My kitchen is larger than the onsite convenience store. The restaurant was also small, but the breakfast food that I had was very good. However, I think the hotel is suited more for business travel rather than family vacations. I booked a room on the executive floor for a Friday and Saturday night stay. I was informed after my arrival that the hospitality suite is not open or available on Fridays and Saturdays. I was unable to purchase or receive a newspaper within or immediately outside of the hotel. I had to get in my car and drive to a bookstore on the other side of the freeway to purchase a newspaper. I feel the price of the hotel is somewhat high for what you receive, but is probably OK for business men and women on an expense account. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhcop
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was nice. The walls are thin, you can hear the people coughing, etc. in the next room. The service was good, the in house restaurant was whatever. There are a lot of places to eat around the hotel, I recommend eating out. Very close to the zoo and sea world. About 10 minutes to each.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible disappearing valets!”
Reviews.Author: OldGal&Todd
Reviews.Content: We pulled up to the property tired after a long flight, and the valet parkers (2 or 3 of them) asked if we wanted valet parking or self-parking. We picked self-parking, and ALL of the valets actually levitated and disappeared in a flash! We actually laughed, but my husband was not pleased to be lugging two suitcases into the hotel while I parked in the clean but cramped and overpriced self-parking. The indifferent desk clerk did not acknowledge our Hilton Honors membership nor offer any amenities. I don't believe we even got a newspaper! While the room was comfortable, hardly anyone was staying at the hotel yet they apparently crammed us all into one corridor so we heard screaming children all night long. I guess the placement of people is for the convenience of the cleaning staff. Anyhow, bored by the hotel and its lack of charm, we checked out after two days and went to a small, family owned property which we enjoyed much more. Then, to top it all off, the Hilton charged my credit card for the whole proposed stay (7 nights), even though we checked out after 2. I called several times, and the staff kept saying "they don't know what happened." Finally I got a helpful accountant/manager who tried to help. The charges eventually went away. So I guess we were pretty disappointed with the lack of service, glitches in accounting, and all-over hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Nomad's Soccer Tournment”
Reviews.Author: Stradavelo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a soccer tournment. I cannot say enough about the beds at this Hilton.....very comfortable. The staff was very helpful to our group and allowed us to use the common areas one evening for a gathering. Parking was expensive and the hot tub had too much Chlorine in it. Close to Starbucks and food. We had a quite room facing away from the freeway. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent San Diego area hotel”
Reviews.Author: miselainis
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to San Diego to visit a cousin, and did not want to fight crowds downtown. I wanted to be relatively close to El Cajon, where she and her husband live. The Hilton is right off the I-8 Expressway, so that was great. Also, there is a large shopping area directly across the street, which came in handy for various items. There is a bookstore, Gordon Biersch Brewery, liquor store, West Elm, and a Westfield mall (which is actually more like an outdoor flea market, and PACKED with aimless kids). It did have a Target and lots of other places, but looked rather grubby, what I saw of it. The Hilton had a spacious lobby, check-in was a breeze, and the room was spacious and comfortable. I had a panoramic view of the highway and shopping across it. The bed was very comfortable, and the internet worked. The toiletries were Crabtree and Evelyn La Source, and smelled wonderful. The bathroom itself was a little dark, but they did have a lighted makeup mirror, which was a nice touch. For dinner, I tried room service, but wasn't that impressed with my Cuban sandwich. It seemed a little dry. The dessert special was a blueberry bread puddng that was pretty good. I even got a call from the staff asking if I'd enjoyed it and if it was OK, which was new. I'd never had that type of customer service before, and appreciated it. The parking garage is over to one side of the hotel, and was a little small, which made it hard to maneuver larger cars (I had rented a Dodge Avenger). I also found it a little difficult to get in and out of. The stairway was very far to one side, and the ramp going in was quite steep. I try to walk direct routes so as not to get too tired (because my legs can get weak), so it was a little inconvenient. There was a reception of some kind the one evening I came back to the hotel after shopping, and I thought, "Oh great. I'm going to hear that all night." I wasn't as worried about the event itself as the party-goers who might be staying at the hotel being loud and disturbing everyone else, but it turns out there was no need for worry. I didn't hear a thing. The layout of the restaurant/bar was confusing if you're coming in from the back bar part of the hotel near the elevators instead of the front entrance. The restaurant entrance is all the way to the other side from the elevators. I came down for breakfast one morning and was very droopy from staying up and watching a late night movie. The restaurant staff stood and watched me a for a few moments, and I finally figured out how to get over to where the food was. THEN they said something like "Over here." They might want to put up signage in the morning if you go in the wrong door so you don't feel like a fool. The eggs benedict were good, but nothing special. Good coffee. All in all, a pleasant stay. Comfortable, but I'd go out to eat more next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: metsisme
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: My review is based on comparing this hotel to others in it's price/star range. Also, a review entitled "Dreadful" below mine is, I think, a review of a different propery, as the Mission Valley Hilton has neither tennis courts nor is it located near the beach, as his review states. Hotel: Well appointed lobby with everything I'd expect to find at a Hilton property. Bar and Restaraunt sit just to the left of the lobby. Quick check-in line for Hilton Honors members. If you get a room on the back side of the hotel, you get a nice view of the Ridgecrest district on the ridge-line behind the hotel. Front side of the hotel looks out over the freeway, but I never had any road noise issues as the hotel is 50 yards or so back from the freeway. Staff: Pretty good job. Only one bit of irritation. There was a rugby tournament in town during the first and second week of my stay. The players were well behaved until the last night when they all got roaring drunk and made noise all night. I've been that guy, so I had some sympathy for them, but maybe Hilton shouldn't be booking them on their Hilton Honors diamond floors. Took awhile for security to quiet them down and eventually the police had to be called. Not really a bad reflection of the hotel, staff could have made better decisions though. Room: Great. Another solid Hilton room. Huge king sized bed. I could lay down on it sideways and at nearly six feet not be going over either side. Everything was always clean and fresh from linens to towels to scent of the room. Restaraunt/Bar: So-so. The small, cozy bar was fun and I met some interesting people there. Drinks a little pricey but they almost always are at an upscale hotel bar. Bartenders very cool and willing to go an extra step for good customers. A girlfriend of mine joined me late one night and they made her a cocktail well after "last call." The resteraunt, Stish, was only average. Not a great selection and the food wasn't all that impressive. Ate out most nights. Other: Didn't have rental car on this trip so I don't know what parking fees were. Both valet and self park are availiable. High-speed internet was a little week. Hotel is fully Wi-Fi enabled but signal strength/speed was weak in my room. If I'm going to pay 10 bucks a day for high speed internet access, I want high speed internet access.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay and convenient to Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Went to a meeting at the San Diego Convention Center, unfortunately had to change arrangements and had to stay outside of the Downtown area. Stayed at the Hilton Hotel in Mission Valley, which turned out to be a great choice for me. It is not that far from the Convention Center and trips from the hotel to the convention only took about 15 minutes via freeway, probably 6 miles. It is very convenient to get to via Interstate 8 and hwy 163. There is a mall area across the freeway with many nearby restaurants--Chevy's, Gordon Birsch, Baja Fresh to name a few and several stores--Borders, Target, Nordstrom Rack. Parking not an issue. Room was spacious, bed comfortable and the staff was very accommodating. It was very quiet, I was on the 10 floor. Did not eat in hotel, did not use exercise room or pool. Self parking is convenient, although $14/nite, unlimited in and out. For the price, I was very pleased with the hotel, the distance from Downtown was insignificant and would definitely recommend staying her again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sugarplumsyum
Reviews.Content: The guest services person was great. I was arriving around 2am and the Hilton customer service rep called the hotel for me to ensure that my room is not given away. I got the executive suite for a great price of $119 on a weekday. Room service was kind, room was clean. I loved the shampoo and conditioner from Crabtree and Evelyn. Most hotels only provide a combination shampoo/conditioners so it was a nice treat to have both separately. I chose the Hilton over the Hilton owned doubletree, because I heard that this Hilton had recently undergone rehab...and most importantly, it had a nice down comforter to make my business trip comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, a great location outside of downtown”
Reviews.Author: cubanito1
Reviews.Content: OK first off I got a great deal 5 night plus a car for 500 bucks on Expedia when booking together. The HIlton Mission is OK, its not great. They charge you 12 bucks a day to park, which is dumb. They do have wireless internet in rooms at 9bucks for 24hours which is somewhat reasonable. Pros: Location is 10 minutes to downtown, or Seaworld, and right across the interstate are all the mall shops and restaurants you could ask for. Cons: Got a room facing the freeway, on the 11th floor, but still noisy. I didnt mind it too much though, only when the cops are flying down the highway with sirens on. 12 bucks to park, although you do get in and out privlages. All in all not the best Hilton Ive stayed at, but it was clean, comfortable and a great value. I would stay here again and not have to pay out the but for a classier downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: savecal$
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on rewards points through Hilton. The hotel was nice and clean and the staff was friendly. Really liked the beds and the bath amenities. Room was decent size, bathroom clean. Robes and slippers in room, which was nice. The pictures of the rooms are exact. We had the breakfast buffet in the hotel at $12.95pp and it was good. Didn't see the pool. Great location if you want to be close to most anything. Not the best hotel for a "romantic" stay--try La Jolla or by the bay. Great for families or 1st time visitors to San Diego. Again, you can get just about anywhere in 10-20 from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a very nice property and our experience was a good one. First the positives: - Good size rooms, nicely furnished, great beds. - Good location (just a few miles from all of the major attractions and is right across the street from lots of food and shopping). - Rock bottom price through Priceline bidding process (if I was basing the review on the price I got I would easily give it the top 5 of 5 rating, my 4 of 5 rating is purposely leaving price out as a factor in order to give a fair rating). - Great service... the front desk people were fantastic and they were very receptive to all of my requests and needs (some times when you get a room through Priceline or Hotwire you end up not getting quite the same level of service from the hotel that you would otherwise). Neutral: - Pool and spa were small, but serviceable and had long hours. - Styling in the rooms was a little dated, but nicely maintained with lots of quality touches (I imagine the renovated rooms must be extremely nice). Negatives: - Parking was tight and the parking elevators were out of service. In fairness they did offer valet parking at no additional charge though because of the elevator situation. The $12/night seemed unnecessary for the hotel circle area (I would expect it downtown, but not here). On the other hand after having recently paid: $22 in Arlington VA (outside of Washington DC), $29 in Toronto, $39 in Chicago, and $47 in New York City the $12 here didn't seem quite so bad. - Once an hour or so the A/C unit would make a noticeable "thumping" sound. Wasn't so bad that we lost any sleep though. Overall would recommend this hotel highly and I would be thrilled if I ever "won" this property again through either Priceline or Hotwire.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton San Diego Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 901 Camino del Rio South, San Diego, CA 92108
